title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Central African Republic
summary: The document titled "Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Central African Republic" announces the extension of a national emergency originally declared on May 12, 2014, by Executive Order 13667. This emergency was established due to significant threats to U.S. national security and foreign policy arising from severe instability in the Central African Republic, characterized by lawlessness, violence, and the use of child soldiers. The ongoing situation, exacerbated by actions from entities like the Kremlin-linked Wagner Group, continues to pose a serious threat, necessitating the continuation of this emergency status for an additional year beyond May 12, 2025. The notice will be published in the Federal Register and communicated to Congress, reaffirming the U.S. government's commitment to addressing the crisis in the region.
